conversion_verification.notes: The 3D render clearly shows walls with height and thickness, a perceptible interior volume, an angled view, and a cutaway roof exposing the interior.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Walls have height (5), thickness (5) and floors are distinct (3). Interior volume is clear (4). Proper corner geometry (3). Angled view is perfect (5), interior visible from elevated perspective (3). Minimal distortion (2). Roof cleanly removed (5), interior fully visible (3). Clean geometry (2).

geometric_accuracy.notes: Correct number of rooms (3). Adjacency is mostly correct, but the entrance area from the 2D plan is slightly different (3/4). Relative room proportions preserved (3). Major room identities match (2). Major wall positions align well (5), wall lengths are proportional (3). Internal partitions are correctly placed (2). Doors are present and on correct walls, though the 'Entrance' door is slightly different in its 2D representation versus the 3D model (3/4). Windows are present and on correct walls (2). Openings are proportionally sized (2).

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present for living and dining areas, and kitchen elements are present (4). Bathroom fixtures are present (2). Furniture placed in correct rooms (3). Furniture scale seems reasonable (2). Orientation is logical (2).

visual_clarity.notes: Walls, floors, and openings are clearly distinguishable (4). Geometry is readable (4). Interior is clearly visible (3). Lighting could be slightly better to highlight geometry more (2/3). Consistent material usage (2). No major rendering artifacts (2). Background is clean (2). The 'ENTRANCE' label is part of the 3D geometry which is not ideal, but not explicitly a text label overlay.

detected_errors.description: The 'ENTRANCE' text is part of the 3D model, integrated into the wall, which is not ideal and impacts the aesthetic and clarity slightly.
Slight discrepancy in the entrance door representation and the area around the stairs between the 2D plan and 3D model.

summary: The 3D rendering is a good and geometrically faithful transformation of the 2D floor plan, with minor discrepancies in the entrance area and lighting.
